poem:
**Torrent's Grasp**

In the sudden swell,
Mallorca took you, unnamed
bodies to the sea,
each wave a whisper
of your fleeting life.  
Among torrents, you  
float untethered,  
echoes lost to stone,  
flood's final claim.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. It comes after the body of a British woman was found on the Spanish tourist island on Wednesday. Both people are believed to have been swept away in a flash flood. Emergency services had been searching the area near the Torrent de Pareis". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
